column1: 2310|ten past eleven|So that was how I spent Christmas night from about ten past eleven until nearly two in the morning
column4: hearing the crackle and hiss of burning logs as I kept up the fire
column5: watching my cousin drink steadily until the whisky bottle was empty.

column1: 2310|Ten past eleven|She backed down the driveway
column3:
and turned toward the turnpike. Ten past eleven. Plenty of time.

column1: 2310|ten past eleven|Another Christmas day is nearly over. It's ten past eleven. Richard declined with thanks my offer to make up a bed for him here in my study
column2: and has driven off back to Cambridge
column3: so I am able to make some notes on the day before going to bed myself.

column1: 2310|ten minutes past eleven|He had not the strength to help himself
column2: and at ten minutes past eleven no one could have helped him
